page.title: 14TOURISM AT TATTON PARK
page.content: Within Knutsford we have a unique park, called Tatton Park. It attracts sixty two thousand tourists a year to take in its many attractions. These include the two halls, the gardens and the mere. Many sports take place on the mere, like windsurfing, boat and yacht sailing and fishing. Exhibitions take place at the new hall yearly and these are very popular with tourists. There is the Cheshire Show that takes place annually and there is also the Craft Fair in which people show off their talents. TV's "Brideshead Revisited" was made there. Backing onto the house are Tatton's famous gardens. In this garden different countries are represented by typical buildings and plants from that country. Tatton Park attracts tourists from all over the world.
